00031 enum PWM_IDX {
00032         PWM_IDX00 = 0,  // Timer 1 CH1
00033         PWM_IDX01,              // Timer 1 CH2
00034         PWM_IDX02,              // Timer 1 CH3
00035         PWM_IDX03,              // Timer 1 CH4
00036         PWM_IDX04,              // Timer 2 CH1
00037         PWM_IDX05,              // Timer 2 CH2
00038         PWM_IDX06,              // Timer 2 CH3
00039         PWM_IDX07,              // Timer 2 CH4
00040         PWM_IDX08,          // Timer 3 CH1
00041         PWM_IDX09,              // Timer 3 CH2
00042         PWM_IDX10,              // Timer 3 CH3
00043         PWM_IDX11,              // Timer 3 CH4
00044         PWM_IDX12,              // Timer 4 CH1
00045         PWM_IDX13,              // Timer 4 CH2
00046         PWM_IDX14,              // Timer 4 CH3
00047         PWM_IDX15               // Timer 4 CH4
00048 };

00052 class HAL_PWM : public GenericIOInterface { ///< one object per pwm (+ one GPIO to set direction)
00053 
00054         HW_HAL_PWM* context;
00055 
00056 public:
00057 
00058 
00059         HAL_PWM(PWM_IDX idx);
00060         int init(int frequency = 1000, int increments = 256); // one period is divided in N increments
00061         int config(PWM_PARAMETER_TYPE type, int paramVal = 0);
00062         void reset();
00063     bool readyToSend()  { return true; }
00064     bool dataReady()    { return true; }
00065     int write(const char* sendBuf, int len) { return 0; }
00066     int read(char* recBuf, int maxlen) { return 0; }
00067     int writeRead(const char* sendBuf, int len, char* recBuf, int maxlen) { return 0; }
00068     /*** Extra only for PWM **/
00069     int write(unsigned int pulseWidthInIncs);                   // 0 ... +increments
00070 
00071 };

00083 //
00084 ///* timers with pwm feature:
00085 // * STM32F103_MD: 1,2,3,4,5 (Olimex STM32-P103) ! Timer 5 has no output pins!
00086 // * STM32F103_HD: 1,2,3,4,5,8 (FIRST Multisensorboard)
00087 // *
00088 // * every timer has 4 channels = 4 outputs/pins
00089 // * all channels share the same clock -> so the choosen pwm frequency is valid for all channels
00090 // *
00091 // * !!! When using RODOS, Timer 2 is already in use for time base !!!
00092 // *
00093 // * only timer 1 to 4 are supported by this driver
00094 // */
00095 //
00096 //
00097 ///**
00098 //  * @brief  number of steps one period is divided in
00099 //  */
00100 //#define PWM_RESOLUTION 256
00101 //
00102 //
00103 //#ifdef __cplusplus
00104 //extern "C" {
00105 //#endif
00106 //
00107 //typedef enum
00108 //{
00109 //      TIM_CHAN1,
00110 //      TIM_CHAN2,
00111 //      TIM_CHAN3,
00112 //      TIM_CHAN4
00113 //} TIM_CHAN_TypeDef;
00114 //
00115 //
00116 ///**
00117 //  * @brief  Initializes timer in PWM mode
00118 //  * @param  TIMx: where x can be 1,2,3,4 to select the TIMx peripheral.
00119 //  * @note
00120 //  *   - timer 5 has also a PWM mode, but there is no output pin on LD and MD devices
00121 //  * @param  channel: specifies the output channel of TIMx to be used
00122 //  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00123 //  *     @arg TIM_CHAN1: channel 1
00124 //  *     @arg TIM_CHAN2: channel 2
00125 //  *     @arg TIM_CHAN3: channel 3
00126 //  *     @arg TIM_CHAN4: channel 4
00127 //  * @param  frequency: frequency of PWM signal
00128 //  *           This parameter can be any value between: 10 and 100000 with PWM_RESOLUTION set to 256.
00129 //  * @param defaultPulseWidth: pulsewidth of high-pulse at starttime
00130 //  *           This parameter can be any value between 1 and PWM_RESOLUTION-1.
00131 //  * @retval int
00132 //  *   0  - everything is fine
00133 //  *   -1 - a parameter is not in the valid range
00134 //  */
00135 //int pwm_init(TIM_TypeDef * TIMx, TIM_CHAN_TypeDef channel, int frequency, int defaultPulseWidth);
00136 //
00137 ///**
00138 //  * @brief  Set pulsewidth of high-pulse of PWM-signal
00139 //  * @param  TIMx: where x can be 1,2,3,4 to select the TIMx peripheral.
00140 //  * @note
00141 //  *   - timer 5 has also a PWM mode, but there is no output pin on LD and MD devices
00142 //  * @param  channel: specifies the output channel of TIMx to be used
00143 //  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00144 //  *     @arg TIM_CHAN1: channel 1
00145 //  *     @arg TIM_CHAN2: channel 2
00146 //  *     @arg TIM_CHAN3: channel 3
00147 //  *     @arg TIM_CHAN4: channel 4
00148 //  * @param pulseWidth: pulsewidth of high-pulse
00149 //  *           This parameter can be any value between 1 and PWM_RESOLUTION-1.
00150 //  * @retval int
00151 //  *   0  - everything is fine
00152 //  *   -1 - a parameter is not in the valid range
00153 //  */
00154 //int pwm_setPulseWidth(TIM_TypeDef * timer, TIM_CHAN_TypeDef channel, int pulseWidth);
